benchmark_details.name: ETD Dataset
benchmark_details.overview: The ETD dataset is specifically designed for training and evaluating end-turn detection models, consisting of synthetic and real conversational data to better understand speech heuristics in human dialogue.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a public dataset for training and evaluating end-turn detection in spoken dialogue systems.

data.source: Synthetic data generated from text dialogues and real speech collected from YouTube and Buckeye speech corpus.
data.size: 120,000 samples, over 300 hours of conversational data
data.annotation: Annotations are based on a ternary classification of the speech segments (Speaking Unit, Gap, Pause).

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of models evaluated on the ETD dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values of precision, recall, and F1 score indicate better performance in correctly identifying end-turns in the conversation.
methodology.baseline_results: GRU model achieved an accuracy of 79.34%, while Wav2vec 2.0 achieved 99.49% on binary classification.
